title: Provides that permanent impairment or incapacitation of one spouse shall not preclude husband and wife from adopting together or a competent spouse from adopting
summary: Provides that the permanent impairment or incapacitation of one spouse shall not preclude a husband and wife from adopting together or a competent spouse from adopting as a single parent.

       Introduced  by  Sens.  OPPENHEIMER,  DILAN,  KRUEGER  --  read twice and
         ordered printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee  on
         Children and Families

       AN ACT to amend the domestic relations law, in relation to who may adopt
         a person

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The closing  paragraph  of  section  110  of  the  domestic
    2  relations  law,  as added by chapter 522 of the laws of 1999, is amended
    3  to read as follows:
    4    It shall be unlawful to preclude  a  prospective  adoptive  parent  or
    5  parents  solely on the basis that the adoptor or [adopters] ADOPTORS has
    6  had, or has cancer, or any other disease. THE  PERMANENT  IMPAIRMENT  OR
    7  INCAPACITATION  OF ONE SPOUSE SHALL NOT PRECLUDE A HUSBAND AND WIFE FROM
    8  ADOPTING TOGETHER OR THE COMPETENT SPOUSE  FROM  ADOPTING  AS  A  SINGLE
    9  PARENT.  Nothing  herein  shall  prevent  the rejection of a prospective
   10  applicant based upon his or her poor health or limited life expectancy.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
